Fun fact (10 years later and I don't know who's gonna read this): The reason cats and dogs can eat only a single food and be completely fine is simple. They don't eat one thing but their food is a mixture of things. For example, I just bought a food for my dog today that is a mixture of "beef and vegetables" (there was one that was "chicken and vegetables" as well). As long as you're getting the energy (calories) and nutrients you need, you can eat the same thing every day and you'll be completely fine. That's also a common practice for people that want to lose weight or build muscle. So there are tons of people who do this practice anyway.

You can start a sentence with 'because' if your sentence is referring to a cause and effect. For example, "Because the girl was severely depressed, she suffered from a loss of appetite." Because could also be interchanged with the word 'since'. Another way to make my above sentence correct you could say "The girl suffered from a loss of appetite because she was severely depressed." Both have the same meaning and are correct; they simply have a different word order.

You don't make a clone by somehow photo-copying an adult version of you, and ending up with an adult clone. You create a fertilized egg with your genetic makeup. Thus the clone ALSO has to go through development, all the way from a fertilized egg to an adult, which involves maturation in a womb. And since the specific circumstances in the womb affect the development of the specific details of a fingerprint, the clones end up with unique fingerprints.

"How many combos" is a fairly easy question to answer. In North America, we have 10-digit phone numbers. That's 10,000,000,000 possibilities. However, area codes can't start with 0, so subtract 1/10th of those numbers, and the 7-digits can't start with 0, so subtract 1/10th of 10,000,000 (how many possibilities of 7 numbers there are). You're left with AROUND 9,009,000,000 combinations. Hard to answer for the world, because of different phone number formats for different parts of the world.

Random mutations generate new traits (seldomly out of many mutations). These are selected upon by natural selection. When (rarely) some are beneficial these changes tend to accumulate in the genome leading to changes over time (ie. evolution). The former is "random" and the latter is anything but. Thus, saying that people who accept the current understanding of evolution think that "everything around us just happened by chance" is misinformed at the very least.

PS: "butterfly" is not a species.
